result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Failure to Install Ignition Interlock Device

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Clayton A Lebarron

records.addlTxt:
9:34 AM Cases called: 22CM92, 22CM256 & 22CM331 with multiple citations. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Clayton A Lebarron in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Clayton A Lebarron. There is an agreement. 

Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count 1: in 22CM92 Operate Firearm While Intoxicated and 22TR651 OWI 1st. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts plea and finds the defendant guilty. 

Court orders:
22CM92: 80 hours of community service or 10 days jail with Huber if available - chose jail and has 60 days to report, provide DNA sample and pay court costs and surcharges. If successful - expungement is possible of this case only.
22TR651: $924.50 plus $36.40, 8 months driver's license revocation, 12 month IID, AODA and driver safety plan - 2 days jail credit towards the fine. 

Anything else is ordered dismissed and read in - including citations.

Conditions:
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license and IID installed. 
(Covers 22CM256, 22CM331)

Cases called at 9:56 AM: 22CM256, 22CM92, 22CM331.
Prosecuting Attorney Trenton John Piltz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Clayton A Lebarron in court with Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard. 
22CM256, 22CM331: Defendant waives reading of Complaint. Defendant ordered to provide fingerprints today and to contact the Public Defender's Office to have Attorney Rivard appointed in the new cases.
Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 5/16/22 at 1:15 PM.
Hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.
